title: Dashboard Load Performance under Average Data Load
description: Verify that the Operational Command Center dashboard loads within 3-4 seconds when populated with average data volumes.

steps.description: Navigate to the Operational Command Center Dashboard with average amount of service orders, technician schedules, and inventory data loaded
Measure and confirm that the dashboard loading time is within 3-4 seconds

title: Real-time Synchronization of Service Orders and Inventory
description: Verify that changes in service orders and inventory data are updated in real-time across all clients using Supabase Realtime.

steps.description: Update service order status on one client instance
Verify that the updated status is reflected immediately on other clients' dashboards
Update inventory quantities on one client instance
Verify that critical stock alerts and inventory tables on other clients update instantly

title: Role-Based Access Control and Authorization
description: Verify that authentication enforces multi-role (Admin, Technician, Client) access with correct permissions and data isolation using Supabase RLS.

steps.description: Login as Admin user
Verify access to all features including dashboard, service order creation, assignment, and inventory management
Login as Technician user
Verify access limited to mobile web app with assigned orders and updates; no access to admin features
Login as Client user
Verify access limited to viewing own service orders and status
Attempt unauthorized access to restricted data or pages with each role
Verify access is denied and properly handled

title: Critical Stock Alert Functionality
description: Verify that the inventory system accurately displays critical stock alerts when inventory quantities drop below predefined minimum levels.

steps.description: Reduce stock of an inventory item below its critical threshold
Confirm that a critical stock alert is shown clearly in the inventory management table
Increase stock back above the critical threshold
Confirm that the critical stock alert is removed

title: Offline-First Access and Synchronization in Mobile Web App for Technicians
description: Verify that technicians can access schedules and service details offline and that updates are synchronized when connectivity is restored.

steps.description: Simulate offline mode on technician mobile web app
Verify that service orders and schedules previously loaded remain accessible
Update service order status and record material usage in offline mode
Restore network connectivity
Verify that updates made offline are synchronized correctly to the backend and reflected in the dashboard

title: Automatic Company Data Filling via CNPJ Integration
description: Verify that when creating a client using CNPJ, company details are fetched and auto-filled correctly.

steps.description: Create a new client in backoffice and input a valid CNPJ number
Verify that company name, address, and other relevant fields are automatically filled with accurate data
Input an invalid or non-existent CNPJ number
Verify that auto-fill does not occur and appropriate error or validation messages are shown

title: Automatic Budget Calculation Accuracy
description: Verify that automatic budget calculation correctly factors estimated time, selected materials, and configurable price tables when creating service orders.

steps.description: Create a service order with specific estimated time and select multiple materials with known prices
Verify that the calculated budget matches the expected sum of time cost and material costs according to pricing tables
Update estimated time or selected materials
Verify that the budget updates automatically and correctly reflecting changes

title: Service Order Creation and Initial Status
description: Verify that backoffice users can create service orders that are assigned 'Pending' status by default with correct client data.

steps.description: Create a client and service order with valid details via backoffice
Confirm the new service order appears in the service order listing with status 'Pending' and correct client information

title: Service Order Assignment and Reassignment to Technicians
description: Verify that operations coordinators can assign and reassign service orders to technicians using the Command Center dashboard including filtering and calendar views.

steps.description: Use the dashboard filters to locate a pending service order
Assign the service order to a technician via the assignment interface
Verify the order status updates and the technician sees the order in their mobile web app
Reassign the order to a different technician
Verify the reassignment is correctly reflected in all clients and the mobile app

title: Filtering Options on Dashboard
description: Verify that the dashboard filtering functionality returns accurate results when filtering service orders by technician, order status, service type, and period.

steps.description: Apply filter by a specific technician
Confirm all displayed orders belong to the selected technician
Filter orders by status (e.g., 'pending', 'executing')
Confirm only orders with the selected status are displayed
Filter by service type
Verify only orders matching the service type criteria are shown
Filter by date period (day/week/month)
Verify that displayed orders fall within the selected time range
Apply multiple filters in combination
Verify the results correctly match all applied criteria

title: Service Order Status Progression and Digital Signature Capture in Mobile App
description: Verify that technicians can update service order status through workflow steps and capture client digital signatures securely.

steps.description: Technician navigates to assigned service order on mobile web app
Update order status sequentially through 'en route', 'executing', to 'completed'
Verify each status update is saved and reflected immediately in the dashboard
Capture client digital signature via mobile app interface
Verify digital signature is securely stored and associated with the service order

title: High-Density Inventory Table Usability and Data Presentation
description: Verify the inventory management table efficiently supports high-density data presentation with search, filtering, and scroll functionality.

steps.description: Open the inventory management view with a large set of inventory items
Verify smooth scrolling and correct rendering of all rows and columns
Use search and filter inputs to find specific inventory items
Verify the inventory table updates to show correct filtered results accurately and quickly

title: User Interface Compliance with Tailwind CSS and Accessibility Standards
description: Verify that all user interface components throughout the system follow Tailwind CSS design patterns and provide clear visual feedback, supporting usability and accessibility.

steps.description: Navigate through key UI components including login, dashboards, mobile app views, forms, and tables
Verify consistent styling adhering to Tailwind CSS design system and appropriate use of colors, spacing, fonts
Verify UI elements meet basic accessibility guidelines, e.g. keyboard navigability and screen reader labels

title: Error Handling on Service Order Creation with Invalid Inputs
description: Verify that the system prevents creation of service orders with invalid or incomplete data and provides meaningful error messages.

steps.description: Attempt to create a service order missing required fields such as client or service type
Verify error messages are displayed and the order is not created
Enter invalid formats for fields like dates or numbers
Verify validation messages appear and prevent submission
